other_tests.findings: Initial response to DBS was excellent; energy levels increased and family noted behavior improvements.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At 4.5 months post-initial programming, the patient reported increased dyskinesia. Following reprogramming due to behavioral issues, mood and behavior improved, but irritability and cognitive decline developed over 17 months.

other_tests.findings: Initial testing showed nearly normal cognitive functioning with isolated mild to moderate impairment on semantic verbal fluency; subsequent testing noted average performance but slight declines in several cognitive domains.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Overall performance was stable in tasks of attention, verbal comprehension improved; meanwhile, cognitive decline was noted with specific declines in perceptual reasoning and working memory.
